intro: Ischaemum helferi, commonly known as the narrowleaf beakgrass, is a flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Ischaemum helferi is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
